page.title: 13Farming in Kemsing
page.content: In our area the predominant agricultural land use is pastureland, with very small areas of orchard and grain crops. The grazing areas are of rough pasture in fields which vary in size from approximately 750sq.m. to 2000sq.m. This is permanent grassland used on a rotational basis with neighbouring fields for sheep (mainly Kents) and horses. These fields are largely separated by hedges of hawthorn, hazel and oak, with blackberry, dog-rose and convolvulus mingling amongst them, though barbed wire fences thread through the hedges to close gaps where the original hedge has died. The orchards in this area are small patches of apple orchard, and any fields of grain crops are very small.
